intro: Pongati, commonly known as the water lily, is a flowering plant that thrives in freshwater environments. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is characterized by its floating leaves and showy, waterborne flowers. The plant has broad, rounded leaves that provide a habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its flowers, which can be white, pink, or yellow, typically open in the morning and close in the evening. Pongati plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to water filtration and supporting biodiversity.
